intro: Daucus hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Daucus hirsutus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is not typically cultivated for food but is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
